byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dalia Sussman, Giovanni Russonello, Nate Cohn and Marina Stefan.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN

abstract: New York Times/CBS News Poll shows large numbers of Democrats and Republicans are disappointed with or skeptical of Hillary Rodham Clinton and Donald Trump as their party's presidential candidate.

headline.print_headline: Voters Unhappy With Their Candidates, Poll Finds
headline.main: Poll Finds Voters in Both Parties Unhappy With Their Candidates

snippet: Voters expressed deep misgivings about their presumptive nominees in a New York Times/CBS News poll. The race between Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton is tied....
lead_paragraph: Voters expressed deep misgivings about their presumptive nominees in a New York Times/CBS News poll. The race between Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton is tied.
